summary: Remember back when Micheal Sheen first said Aziraphale was in love with Crowley and it was like "oh cool, what an off the cuff...
body: Remember back when Micheal Sheen first said Aziraphale was in love with Crowley and it was like “oh cool, what an off the cuff comment,, nice of him to consider the romantic nature of it all” ?? but fast forward to now and he’s genuinely bringing it up multiple times, unpromted in every interview like okay Micheal we been knew

summary: absolutely adore the idea of heaven and hell between in different sections of the same building because it definitely opens up...
body:
absolutely adore the idea of heaven and hell between in different sections of the same building because it definitely opens up the concept of intersection. demons daring each other to take the elevators up to the top floors and seeing how long it is before they’re caught. angels having a crummy day riding down to hell’s cafeteria to get the truly wicked fast food selection instead of the salad bar. horror stories of ‘oh yeah and then i got back up to the top floor and caught my reflection in the mirror and found out i’d had my shirt on backwards and all the demons i thought i’d been intimidating had just been laughing at me’ and ‘you’ll never guess who i just saw in the elevator–metatron. thought he was going to smite me right then but he just asked what floor i needed. made him ride all the way down to the bottom just to see if he was really that polite.’ 

the first time crowley and aziraphale actually met, it was when aziraphale went into the bathroom on the third floor from the top and found crowley inspecting the tissue paper. ‘we don’t get paper like this downstairs,’ he’d explained, apparently unconcerned about being caught. ‘downstairs it’s so thin it’s see through.’ aziraphale had made the appropriate sympathetic noises and miracled a roll out of its holder for him to take with him. ‘for emergencies,’ he’d said in a stage whisper. ‘as long as you promise to stop soaping up the mirrors every time you come in here.’ crowley had nodded, unembarrassed still at having been caught doing that as well, then said, ‘isn’t it a bit against the rules to make deals with demons?’ and aziraphale had shrugged, though a bit sheepishly. ‘of course it is, but the soap is really just unbearable, it goops everywhere, and it takes them forever to clean it up, and–’ he had looked up at crowley imploringly. ‘it’s not like you’ll report me, will you?’ he’d asked, as if he were the one being caught in the wrong floor’s bathroom. and crowley had laughed and said no, he wouldn’t, and when he’d seen the same angel later, on earth, on the eastern gate, he’d thought, oh right, this bloke, well he’s all right then isn’t he, and had tried not to be disappointed when aziraphale hadn’t remembered him. 

(aziraphale had remembered him, but thought it wasn’t quite the done thing to bring up deals made over loo rolls from the bathroom on the third floor from the top when they were supposed to be adversaries on earth now. he’d regretted it for six thousand years, until finally the apocalypse had been averted, and then he’d thought, what the hell, this might as well happen, and asked crowley if he had any of that loo roll left. crowley had first been furious, but eventually he’d just smeared soap over the bookshop’s bathroom mirrors to get even, which hadn’t had quite the effect he’d wanted but which was all right anyway because it had made aziraphale laugh.)

reblog.comment:

the first time crowley and aziraphale actually met, it was when aziraphale went into the bathroom on the third floor from the top and found crowley inspecting the tissue paper. ‘we don’t get paper like this downstairs,’ he’d explained, apparently unconcerned about being caught. ‘downstairs it’s so thin it’s see through.’ aziraphale had made the appropriate sympathetic noises and miracled a roll out of its holder for him to take with him. ‘for emergencies,’ he’d said in a stage whisper. ‘as long as you promise to stop soaping up the mirrors every time you come in here.’ crowley had nodded, unembarrassed still at having been caught doing that as well, then said, ‘isn’t it a bit against the rules to make deals with demons?’ and aziraphale had shrugged, though a bit sheepishly. ‘of course it is, but the soap is really just unbearable, it goops everywhere, and it takes them forever to clean it up, and–’ he had looked up at crowley imploringly. ‘it’s not like you’ll report me, will you?’ he’d asked, as if he were the one being caught in the wrong floor’s bathroom. and crowley had laughed and said no, he wouldn’t, and when he’d seen the same angel later, on earth, on the eastern gate, he’d thought, oh right, this bloke, well he’s all right then isn’t he, and had tried not to be disappointed when aziraphale hadn’t remembered him. 

(aziraphale had remembered him, but thought it wasn’t quite the done thing to bring up deals made over loo rolls from the bathroom on the third floor from the top when they were supposed to be adversaries on earth now. he’d regretted it for six thousand years, until finally the apocalypse had been averted, and then he’d thought, what the hell, this might as well happen, and asked crowley if he had any of that loo roll left. crowley had first been furious, but eventually he’d just smeared soap over the bookshop’s bathroom mirrors to get even, which hadn’t had quite the effect he’d wanted but which was all right anyway because it had made aziraphale laugh.)

summary:
Okay we're all still in the dark about that chain Crowley wears right?
I'll just go ahead and say the most probable and basic af...
body:
Okay we’re all still in the dark about that chain Crowley wears right?

I’ll just go ahead and say the most probable and basic af and definitely wrong theory so that we can start eliminating:

Crowley got Aziraphale the ring he wears as a symbol of The Arrangement and Aziraphale got Crowley the chain.

summary:
Pair songs with 5 of your favorite ships, then tag 5 people
New ask game, requested by @imogen-theimaginedcat based on an...
body:
Pair songs with 5 of your favorite ships, then tag 5 people

New ask game, requested by @imogen-theimaginedcat based on an anonymous message, I got tagged by @fortheothermisfits

phew this was really hard because I never deliberately thought about pairing ships with songs?? but I tried for this & simply took OTPs that I’ve already had some kind of music in mind

1. Sailor Uranus & Neptune (HaruMichi): obviously has to be any song that was composed for violin ever. take your pick.

2. Antinoos & Hadrian: a real historic couple and not a fictional one, but their love story is the greatest and most tragic thing and definitely greater than any fiction or made up story could ever be. Real life really does write the best stories sometimes. And I actually always had a perfect song for them in my head (which is why I had to include them here): Legendary Lovers by Katy Perry. And the lyrics “Go down in history, Go down together, into infinity, forever. Take me down to the river underneath the blood orange sun” hit SO HARD considering how their story ends, whoa. (Antinoos drowned in Nile at sunset, in case you don’t know. Hadrian built a city in his honor at the site that is still existent today - he also founded a cult that lead to every second statue you see in Rome today still bearing Antinoos’ face. Talk about commitment, ha) No one can convince me that Katy did not write that song about these two specifically with all the other direct Egyptian innuendos she put into it, okay.

3. Gigolas: a couple that LITERALLY SAILS INTO THE SUNSET TOGETHER HELLO?????!!!! Your otp could never XD song for them DEFINITELY has to be one of the old gaelic folk songs, for example “Mo Ghille Mear” or “Mairead Nan Cuiread” (OH MY GOD THE LYRICS!! ╥_╥). But, seriously, all of those would be fine because they all fit, tbh. (I also always loved “Suantraí Na Maighdide” for it’s perfect melody, but the lyrics don’t fit at all)

4. Lord Dannyl & Tayend of Tremmelin: oh boy. these two were probably my very first actually deliberate OTP (and the first actual openly queer representation that got published like this in a mainstream publication in my country). Thus the amount of feelings & gratitude I have for them. For the book series in general I always had a soundtrack by Florence and the Machine in mind. But for these two specifically? Man I don’t know. Maybe Pompeii by Bastille since it kinda matches what they went through (specifically having to start from literal ruins multiple times). It comes close. Please let me know if you have another song, I’d like to know.

5. Halvor & Ronin: once again, I always had the perfect song in mind for the whole series: Kingdom Burning Down by Vanilla Ninja. It gives me chills how absolutely perfect it is for these books (or any VN song, really). And for this relationship specifically it probably gotta be Silence (also by Vanilla Ninja, their whole vibe just fits okay). They met during their lonely exiles, I mean COME ON! These songs and the book series actually irk me so much that I am determined to make a TV adaption of these books myself, if no one else ever does it. Just so I can put it on the official soundtrack. However the hell I’m gonna do that. I may have already composed an expose I can sent to Netflix now that people need something else like this after Game of Thrones XD

(didn’t include the Ineffable Husbands™ because it can only be a Queen song ¯\_(ツ)_/¯)

tagging no one because the one I actually want to tag nearly killed me the last time I did it XD (you know, I am talking to you, when you read this, idiot)

So whoever wants to participate, feel free to do so

2. Antinoos & Hadrian: a real historic couple and not a fictional one, but their love story is the greatest and most tragic thing and definitely greater than any fiction or made up story could ever be. Real life really does write the best stories sometimes. And I actually always had a perfect song for them in my head (which is why I had to include them here): Legendary Lovers by Katy Perry. And the lyrics “Go down in history, Go down together, into infinity, forever. Take me down to the river underneath the blood orange sun” hit SO HARD considering how their story ends, whoa. (Antinoos drowned in Nile at sunset, in case you don’t know. Hadrian built a city in his honor at the site that is still existent today - he also founded a cult that lead to every second statue you see in Rome today still bearing Antinoos’ face. Talk about commitment, ha) No one can convince me that Katy did not write that song about these two specifically with all the other direct Egyptian innuendos she put into it, okay.

3. Gigolas: a couple that LITERALLY SAILS INTO THE SUNSET TOGETHER HELLO?????!!!! Your otp could never XD song for them DEFINITELY has to be one of the old gaelic folk songs, for example “Mo Ghille Mear” or “Mairead Nan Cuiread” (OH MY GOD THE LYRICS!! ╥_╥). But, seriously, all of those would be fine because they all fit, tbh. (I also always loved “Suantraí Na Maighdide” for it’s perfect melody, but the lyrics don’t fit at all)

4. Lord Dannyl & Tayend of Tremmelin: oh boy. these two were probably my very first actually deliberate OTP (and the first actual openly queer representation that got published like this in a mainstream publication in my country). Thus the amount of feelings & gratitude I have for them. For the book series in general I always had a soundtrack by Florence and the Machine in mind. But for these two specifically? Man I don’t know. Maybe Pompeii by Bastille since it kinda matches what they went through (specifically having to start from literal ruins multiple times). It comes close. Please let me know if you have another song, I’d like to know.

5. Halvor & Ronin: once again, I always had the perfect song in mind for the whole series: Kingdom Burning Down by Vanilla Ninja. It gives me chills how absolutely perfect it is for these books (or any VN song, really). And for this relationship specifically it probably gotta be Silence (also by Vanilla Ninja, their whole vibe just fits okay). They met during their lonely exiles, I mean COME ON! These songs and the book series actually irk me so much that I am determined to make a TV adaption of these books myself, if no one else ever does it. Just so I can put it on the official soundtrack. However the hell I’m gonna do that. I may have already composed an expose I can sent to Netflix now that people need something else like this after Game of Thrones XD

(didn’t include the Ineffable Husbands™ because it can only be a Queen song ¯\_(ツ)_/¯)

tagging no one because the one I actually want to tag nearly killed me the last time I did it XD (you know, I am talking to you, when you read this, idiot)

So whoever wants to participate, feel free to do so

blog.name: marveliciousfanace
blog.title: Fandom Ace
blog.description:
Remy/20 they/them/theirs
-
This is mostly me reblogging things, along with a few comments of my own. It's a mess, I don't know what to tell you. Currently Kingsman, Good Omens, and Supernatural trash. Check out my AO3, AgentStannerShipper, or send me a prompt.

tags: is that why crowley is just staring at aziraphale in all those promo photos?
summary:
A thought occured to me...
Demons can see in the dark. Without pulling out my book, I'm pretty confident that's just textually...
body:
A thought occured to me…

Demons can see in the dark. Without pulling out my book, I’m pretty confident that’s just textually stated. Additionally, angels cannot, as evidenced by the scene where they hit Anathena (Aziraphale conjures light, and then extinguishes it when they realize a human is around, so the only person whose benefit it could be for is his own).

I’m assuming the major reason for this has to do with the denizens of Hell being modeled after slimy things that crawl around in the muck and tunnel underground (snakes, toads, bugs, etc.). Those creatures would need to see in the dark. Equally, angels should be in Heaven, close to the sun and the light. They’d have no need to see in the dark.

I’m not sure where exactly I’m going with this, other than that maybe this is part of demonic punishment, the Falling. To see in the dark, you need sensitive eyes. Eyes too sensitive to see the light of Heaven.

Maybe Crowley stares at Aziraphale sometimes until his eyes water and burn. It hurts to look at the angel’s holy light, but he’s too beautiful for Crowley to look away.

ko-fi and commissions

a good omens sideblog

summary:
brain: crowley uses the “updog” trick on aziraphale

big brain: adam gets aziraphale and crowley both on “updog”

galaxy brain:...
body:
brain: crowley uses the “updog” trick on aziraphale

big brain: adam gets aziraphale and crowley both on “updog”

galaxy brain: aziraphale hears the “updog” joke from one of the Them and uses it on crowley, who falls for it surprisingly easily. ( “angel, what are you even saying?” “oh, you know ...” a wave of his hand, “updog! crowley, dear, do you not know what updog is?” ) 

is smug about it for the next decade and tells the story to anyone who will listen.
